question: Oliver has a bag of marbles with 88 inside. He tripped over a stick while carrying it and dropped one quarter of them. He scrambled to search for them but only came up with 16. When he went back home, he inspected the marbles further. Two of the ones he picked up weren't marbles, but actually beads so he got rid of them. How many marbles did Oliver end up with?
answer:
Oliver dropped his marbles and was left with 88*3/4=<<88*3/4=66>>66 marbles.
He searched and found some of his lost marbles, getting him back to 66+16=<<66+16=82>>82 marbles.
He went home and removed two beads, leaving him with 82-2=<<82-2=80>>80 marbles.
#### 80
